refnamediv.refpurpose: un-share various namespaces making them private to the process

refsection.title: BSD Note
refsection.para: This command currently has no effect on BSD. Be careful, therefore, of the effect that this will have on make-private-fs1 and make-read-only-fs1.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: unshare is a chain-loading utility that calls unshare2 to "unshare" various "namespaces" from its parent process and then chain loads to next-prog with the execvp3 function.
next-prog may contain its own command line options, which unshare will ignore.
The namespaces un-shared are controlled by command-line options as follows:

listitem.para: The process switches to a private namespace of mounted filesystems.
The process switches to a private namespace of network interfaces.
The process switches to a private namespace of UTS names.
The process switches to a private namespace of IPC names.
The process switches to a private namespace of process IDs.
The process switches to a private namespace of user IDs.

refsection.para: The command will fail if the process is not running under the aegis of the superuser. Non-superusers are not permitted to unshare these things.
